(a) Up to 1989 estimates of mid-year population are from theRegistrar General's Department. From 1990 onwards estimateshave been adjusted based on the Census 2001.(b) Data available only in census years and some survey years(c) From J 990, based on Quarterly Labour Force Survey (aLFS) ofthe DCS. Upto 1989, based on other surveys in which thedefinition may differ.ProvisionalBased on Census of Population and Housing - 2001Average of three quarters. Quarlerly Labour Force Survey (OLFS)was not conducted by the DCS for 2nd Ouarter - 2001

Sources; Registrar General's DepartmentDepartment of Census and StatisticsCentral Bank of Sri Lanka

(g) Upto 2002, QLFS data excluded both Northern and Eastern provinces.commencing from 1st quarter 2003, Eastern province was included and onlvthe Northern Province was excluded from the survevAverage of first three quartersFrom 2004, QLFS data included both Northern and Eastern provinces excludingVavuniya, Killinochchi and Mullaitivu districts and since 2nd quarler 2004 dataincludes all districts

(a) The Centrat Bank be n ounts estimates in es tor the period 1950- 1958 have been co g es in "Estimates ol ross National Productfrom 1950 - 1981", T a tudies vol. 12 No.2 1982 and Vol. 13 No.land 2, April - September, 1983- Therelore, lrom 1950-1958 the sectoral shares do not add to 100%.National Accounts estimates were revised in 1970, 1982, and 1996. The estimates of the latter Series aregiven in this table. The GNP and GDP estimates before the revision are given below:

1970: GDP (current f actor cost prices) = Rs.mn. 11 '705'1982: GDP (current f actor cost prices) = Bs.mn. 91 '943'1996: GDP (current lactor cost prices) = Rs.mn. 695,934'(b) Includes value added of following Sub-sectors :i. Mining and quarryingii. Manufacturingiii. Electricity and wateriv. Construction(c) Includes value added ol following Sub-sectors :i. Wholesale and retail trade, hotels and reslaurantsii. Transport, storage and communicationsiii. Financial services, real eslate, and business serviceslv- Public administration, other government services anddelence, other community, social and personal services.

Source: Central Bank ol Sri Lanka

GNP (current factor cosl prices) = Rs.mn 12'671GNP (current tactor cost prices) = Rs.mn. 89,609GNP (current f actor cost prices) - Rs.mn. 684,676

(d) Represents the consumption basket ol low income households in the colomboMunicipality.(e) Bepresents the consumption basket ol households in the lowest 80 per cent olexpenditure groups in lhe Country, excluding the Northern and Eastern provinces.(f) This series has been computed by splicing several series of implicit GDPdellators obtained with dillerent base years. Hence, it would difler f rom a seriescompiled using the current and constant values ol GDP.(g) Revised(h) Provisional
